resources.string: Orcs Attack! is a collection of small programs that help you DM your pen and paper RPG.

This app is a work in progress. It is being developed by myself in my spare time as a hobby and a way to learn more about Android developement. This app is completely ad-free and collects absolutely no personal data. If you want to report a bug or have an idea for a feature for the app, please contact me! I will be very glad to hear you out and try my best to implement it. Seriously, I would love hearing from you! All the code is open-source and available on Github. Feel free to check it out!

If you enjoyed this app, give it a good rating! If not, give it a bad one! Eitherway, I would very much appreciate you contacting me with your thoughts and views on the app and thoughts on making it better.

The character and tile art for this application is from flaticon! Check them out here
Freepik from www.flaticon.com,
Smashicons from www.flaticon.com Content provided in this app is Open Gaming Content, published in the Systems Reference Document (SRD) available at dnd.wizards.com, licenced under Open Gaming Licence, Vesion 1.0a.

When you check the campfire box, a campfire appears near the middle of your map. If a campfire is present, allied characters appear close to the fire while enemy characters appear far from it. If no campfire is present, all the characters appear randomly. You can set the max distance from the fire that ally characters can spawn, as well as the minimum distance from the campfire for enemies to spawn from the settings tab.
The background images were created by Jason Milios!
Music written and performed by John Skoufoulas!

string-array.name: NPC_secrets
string-array.item: Knows the true identity of an important political figure
Has connection to a thieves guild
Holds a long lost book about wizardry
Knows the lair of a Dragon
Has power over a ruling politician
Is a very wealthy/powerful person in disguise
Knows the position of a magic artifact
Knows how to get to the lair of a bandit group
Knows how to get to the lair of a powerful dark wizard
Knows the secret code to get to an exclusive club/base
Is planning on robbing/killing someone very soon
Is a spy for a foreign power
Know the road to an unknown place of power
Knows a secret about an important figure in a nearby village/town

string-array.name: NPC_characteristics
string-array.item: Walks with an oddly long cane
Cannot talk because of a spell
Has a scar on his/her face
Refers to him/herself with his/her name
Has a very soft and calm voice
Only talks with a few words

string-array.name: NPC_useful_info
string-array.item: Was friends with the last king of the land
Used to live in a now gone city and knows its history
Can point to a secret magic shop
Can point to a shop in the woods owned by a druid
Can give the characters info on the surrounding woods
Can give the characters info on the political situation in a nearby town
Knows about the type of monsters that lurk around the area he/she lives
Knows another adventuring party and their location
Knows people that have quests for the party
Knows lore about a historical event of the land
Knows a famous fairytale of the land
Knows when and who crosses the road we are on
Has the location of a hidden stash

string-array.name: Encounters
string-array.item: A man challenges one member of a party to a duel in a quest to become the strongest duelist in the land. If he loses he invites the party to a tournament he will also be attending for the title of the best duelist in the land, and promises to meet again with the party. Can be used as a recurring encounter.

The party notices a tall obelisk by the side of the road about a kilometer away. If they decide to investigate they stumble accross a group of bandits who use the obelisk to set up ambushes to adventurers. They have never been to the obelisk, they only stay near it because it attracts adventurers. Near the camp they used they have stashed some treasure, and one of them keeps a buried low-level magic item buried nearby. If the party gets close to the obelisk they see writing on the obelisk in a non common language (e.g. Giant). The first member to touch the obelisk gains a permanent (or temporary up to you) +1 to a a stat (roll a d6 for the stat).
